titleStmt.title: Edward F. de Selding to James R. Page
CWG2064

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
EDWARD F. DE SELDING,
Attorney and Counselor at Law,
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS for most of the STATES,
No. 39 WILLIAM STREET.
1 Park Place
New York, March 6th 1865
James R. Page Esqr.
Asst: Secy of State of Ky:
Dear Sir
Your favor of the 9th January was received at my office during my absence from the City, and mislaid by my clerk in consequence of which I did not get it 'till this morning.

I hasten to comply with the requirement named, by inclosing the State tax. Five dollars and would respectfully request that the commission may be dated March 4th for the reason, that inadvertently, on that day. I took the acknowledgment of a party to a power of attorney as Comr for Ky:

Soliciting your kind attention to this
I am Very Respectfully
Your Obty Sevt
Edwd F. deSelding

Comr Deeds
New York
E. F. Edde Selding
apptd & comd
10th Mch 1865
